message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<explanation>>>: The FindBugs warning is indicating that the entrySet() method of the map you are using may reuse the same Map.Entry object during iteration. This means that the Map.Entry object returned by entrySet() may change its value after you have added it to the sortedEntries set. This can cause unexpected behavior or errors when you try to add all the entries to the sortedEntries set using sortedEntries.addAll(map.entrySet()).

To fix this issue, you can create a new Map.Entry object for each entry in the map and add it to the sortedEntries set. Here's an example of how you can modify your code to avoid the FindBugs warning:

static <K,V extends Comparable<? super V>> SortedSet<Map.Entry<K,V>> entriesSortedByValues(Map<K,V> map) {
    SortedSet<Map.Entry<K,V>> sortedEntries = new TreeSet<Map.Entry<K,V>>(
        new Comparator<Map.Entry<K,V>>() {
            @Override
            public int compare(Map.Entry<K,V> e1, Map.Entry<K,V> e2) {
                int res = e1.getValue().compareTo(e2.getValue());
                return res != 0 ? res : 1;
            }
        }
    );

    for (Map.Entry<K,V> entry : map.entrySet()) {
        sortedEntries.add(new AbstractMap.SimpleEntry<>(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue()));
    }

    return sortedEntries;
}

By creating a new AbstractMap.SimpleEntry object for each entry in the map, you ensure that the values of the entries will not change during the iteration and when adding them to the sortedEntries set. This should resolve the FindBugs warning.
